intro: Pasania stenopus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
